bomberman.core.graphics
Class SpritePlayer

java.lang.Object
  bomberman.core.graphics.SpritePlayer

public class SpritePlayer
extends java.lang.Object

The SpritePlayer class reproduces Sprite animations reading sequentially the sprite sheet frame by frame. Due to the necessity to draw at each update, the player makes use of the advantages of GPU accelerated immediate layer, drawing directly on the GPU buffer.

See Also:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics)

Method Detail

Sprite

public Sprite Sprite()
Current Sprite.

Returns:
the current Sprite

draw

public void draw(playn.core.Surface surf,
                 Vector2 position)
Draw the current frame at the position specified by the bottom centered Vector2. This allows us to display animations bigger than the logic DynamicPhysicsEntity body while maintaining centered the image.

Parameters:
surf - the surface on which to draw
position - the bottom centered position on the screen in pixels
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the animation isn't specified

frameIndex

public int frameIndex()
Current frame index.

Returns:
the currently playing frame's index

playAnimation

public void playAnimation(float gameTime,
                          Sprite animation)
Starts or continue the animation playback.

Parameters:
gameTime - the current game time
animation - the animation to play
